{"step_by_step_thinking": "According to the documents, malaria relapse is commonly associated with Plasmodium vivax and Plasmodium ovale. Plasmodium vivax parasites can persist as dormant stages in the liver called hypnozoites, which can cause relapses months or years after the initial infection. Plasmodium ovale infections have also been observed to result in relapses. Therefore, the correct answer is C. Plasmodium vivax and ovale.", "answer_choice": "C"}
